TO: NAEB Board of Directors
Report ft5
12-10-54
From: Frank E
Schoole;
Re: Transfer of treasurers funds and duties*
1. Barring major emergency, treasurer transactions and most duties
tvill be suspended, December 24-319 1954? inclusive. This
period will be used to clear the books, the bank, etc.
2. Effective January 1, 1955? all deposits and all disbursements
will be handled by Bob Coleman.
3. The moratorium will be used to close out of the books, check
accounts, and make necessary statements as of December 31o You’ll
receive a report.
4® On or about December 209 I shall transmit to Bob Coleman a
sum with which to start his account. It probably will be in the
amount of $409000. The balance, I’ll transmit to him earliest
possible moment, probably on December 31 or January 2.
5o Practically all statements for dues and News Letter subscriptions
for 1955 have already been prepared and will be mailed from this
office.
6o Practically* if not all transactions will go through headquarters
so Skornia, Hill* Bidlack, Underwood can check, as well as
assign accounts to which to be charged. This way Bob will have
advice before he has to act as treasurer.
7» Employee checks (Engineering Service and Placement) must always
be written as of the first of the month. This makes it imperative
that Coleman have funds to cover first checks he’ll write, as of
January 1 for December services. To write earlier would complicate
the income tax records of the individuals involved.
Bo Schooley will prepare and file the income tax and the social security
tax report for Internal Revenue.
9* My bond will expire as of December 31« It will not be renewed.
Coleman will have bond, approved by Board, in same amount as
carried by me—$40,000.
